amendment.description: Amendment sought to eliminate $331 million authorized for the B-2 Bomber program and increase funding for National Guard and Reserve equipment by an equal amount. It would have terminated all further funding for the B-2 Bomber program beyond those costs associated with completing the final production stages of the existing 21 bombers and closing down the production line.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, as modified, to eliminate the $331 million in funds for the B-2 Bomber program and to increase funding for National Guard and Reserve equipment by an equal amount. The amendment would terminate all further funding for the B-2 Bomber program beyond costs associated with completing the final production stages of the existing 21 bombers and closing down the production line.

action.text: Dellums amendment (A015) modified by unanimous consent. Modification would transfer funds cut from the B-2 Bomber program to National Guard and Reserve equipment accounts.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Dellums amendment (A015) Failed by recorded vote: 209 - 216 (Roll no. 228).
